title: End of Season Pond Maintenance Tips (Pond and Fish Care)
content:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="4.27.4" _module_preset="default" custom_padding="6px||0px|||" locked="off" collapsed="off" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_row _builder_version="4.27.4" _module_preset="default" width="100%" custom_margin="|0px||0px|false|true" custom_padding="39px|0px||0px|false|true" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="4.24.2" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_margin="||47px|||" custom_padding="0px|||||" global_colors_info="{}"]

As pond owners know, fall is the time to transition your pond from summer enjoyment to winter readiness. By taking the right steps now, you will protect your pond, fish, and equipment throughout the colder months.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://sids-ponds.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/pond-autumn-maintenance.jpg" alt="Fall pond with autumn leaves" title_text="pond-autumn-maintenance" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" custom_padding="1px|||||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_heading title="Remove Debris" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h2" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||10px|||" custom_padding="29px||11px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" global_colors_info="{}"]

Leaves and organic material that sink to the bottom of your pond can cause harmful gas buildup under the ice. Use a pond net to scoop out debris, or install a pond net cover to prevent leaves from falling in.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title="Trim and Clean Aquatic Plants" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h2" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||27px|||" custom_padding="||11px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_padding="||8px|||" global_colors_info="{}"]

Cut back hardy pond plants to just above the waterline and remove dying foliage. For tropical plants, bring them indoors or compost them. This step reduces decaying matter in your pond.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://sids-ponds.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/pond-aquatic-plants.jpg" alt="Aquatic pond plants" title_text="pond-aquatic-plants" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" custom_padding="||15px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_heading title="Care for Your Fish" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h2" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||27px|||" custom_padding="||11px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_padding="||8px|||" global_colors_info="{}"]

Stop feeding fish once the water temperature consistently drops below 10 C (50 F). At that point, their metabolism slows, and uneaten food can pollute the pond. Ensure fish have enough depth, at least 45 to 60 cm, so they can safely survive the winter.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://sids-ponds.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/koi-fish-pond-care.jpg" alt="Koi fish in pond" title_text="koi-fish-pond-care" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" custom_padding="||15px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_heading title="Protect Equipment" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h2" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||27px|||" custom_padding="||11px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_padding="||8px|||" global_colors_info="{}"]

Remove pumps, filters, and UV clarifiers if your pond will freeze solid. Clean and store them in a dry place. If your pond is deep enough to run year-round, switch to a pond aerator or de-icer to maintain a small opening in the ice. This allows for oxygen exchange and prevents toxic gases from being trapped.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title="Cover and Insulate" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h2" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||27px|||" custom_padding="||11px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.8em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_padding="||8px|||" global_colors_info="{}"]

Adding a pond net not only keeps leaves out but also deters predators. In especially harsh climates, consider floating pond heaters to help maintain stable water conditions.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title="Key Takeaway" _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" title_level="h3" title_font="|700|||||||" custom_margin="||19px|||" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.5" _module_preset="default" text_font="|600|||||||" text_text_color="#0a0a0a" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.9em" header_3_font="||||||||" header_3_line_height="1.3em" custom_padding="8px||0px|||" global_colors_info="{}"]

End-of-season pond maintenance ensures healthy fish, clear water, and functioning equipment when spring returns. A few hours of preparation now will prevent costly issues later.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
